Breaking Into Tech Starts with Asking the Right Questions.

Join us for a free virtual info session designed to provide clarity, not pressure.

If you‚Äôre exploring a career in tech but unsure where to begin, this session will help you move from curiosity to confidence.

You‚Äôll gain insights into:
‚úÖ Identifying the tech role that aligns with your strengths
‚úÖ DiscovHer‚Äôs beginner-friendly roadmap for entry into tech
‚úÖ Real-life stories of women who started from scratch
‚úÖ The power of mentorship and community support
‚úÖ Live Q&A to address your specific questions

This isn‚Äôt just another webinar, it‚Äôs an open, judgment-free space to get the answers you need before you take the next big step.

üìÖ Date: Friday, August 15
üïì Time: 12 PM WAT

Career breaks are not failures, they‚Äôre chapters.
 
Whether for caregiving, personal growth, mental health, relocation, or reinvention, breaks are valid.
 
At DiscovHer, we value returners: women who are coming back with stronger self-awareness, renewed purpose, and lived experience.
 
We don‚Äôt see gaps, we see grit.
 
üíª Rebuilding a tech career? You don‚Äôt have to do it alone.

openings, these opportunities are designed with women in tech and allied fields in mind.

Explore roles and programs that value diversity, innovation, and leadership.

The hardest part of growth? Doing what‚Äôs good for me even when it‚Äôs hard.

One quote that reshaped how I think about habits is this:
‚ÄúThe cost of your good habits is in the present. The cost of your bad habits is in the future.‚Äù

That perspective shifted how I approach energy, boundaries, and time. Because not everything that feels easy is helping me grow.

One of the most uncomfortable truths from Atomic Habits is this:
‚ÄúThe greatest threat to success is not failure, it‚Äôs boredom.‚Äù

That‚Äôs been true for me. Some of the most impactful things I‚Äôve built came from doing the same work repeatedly when no one was clapping.

At Wentors , we remind our community that consistency is its own superpower. It‚Äôs not always exciting to keep showing up, keep applying, keep leading. But those who stay the course even when it‚Äôs boring are the ones who break through.

Habits + community = transformation.

 If this resonates with you, share how you stay consistent when motivation fades. Let‚Äôs learn from each other.

#Atomichabits In the latest Spilling the T episode, we're joined by Heather Dawe, UK Head of AI & Innovation and Chief Data Scientist at UST, to explore her 25+ year journey in shaping AI innovation across government, public sector, and industry.

Heather shares her thoughts on:

- Ethical leadership in AI
- The future of tech and public services
- Navigating the industry as a female leader
- Why we need more women in exec roles

With commentary featured in the BBC, Sky News, The FT and more, Heather is a true voice of reason in today‚Äôs AI evolution. Don‚Äôt miss this one!
